metadata.title: Bad Bunny Carpool Karaoke
metadata.description:
James calls on Bad Bunny to help him beat the Los Angeles traffic. The most streamed artist in the world tells James how Benito became Bad Bunny and the two sing some of his most popular songs. And when the topic of wrestling comes up, Bad Bunny recalls perhaps the best day of his life and gives James a taste of life in the ring with help from Rey Mysterio. Full song list:

"Dakiti" - Bad Bunny, Jhay Cortez
"I Like It" - Cardi B, Bad Bunny & J Balvin
"Tití Me Preguntó" - Bad Bunny
"Break Free" - Ariana Grande ft. Zedd
"As It Was" - Harry Styles

metadata.title: The State of Our Union Is Pretty Weird
metadata.description:
Gordon Ramsay is on the show tonight and that always puts us in a great mood. But that good mood becomes testy when James and his producers squabble over some calendar math. In the news, LeBron and President Joe Biden broke records. And James gives a State of the Union recap, including Mitt Romney's exchange with George Santos, Kyrsten Sinema's bowtie pasta look and lots of booing.

metadata.title: The Last Late Late Show: Chapter 5 — One Year To Say Goodbye
metadata.description:
We're celebrating eight years of The Late Late Show with James Corden with a 6-part documentary about the show's history from its inception to the finale. This chapter centers around our final year as James and the team try to figure out the best way to end our show, with a little help from special friends like Adele, Tom Cruise and James' fellow late night hosts.

Stay tuned for our final episode -- Chapter 6!

More Late Late Show:
Subscribe: http://bit.ly/CordenYouTube
Watch Full Episodes: http://bit.ly/1ENyPw4
Facebook: http://on.fb.me/19PIHLC
Twitter: http://bit.ly/1Iv0q6k
Instagram: http://bit.ly/latelategram
TikTok: http://https://www.tiktok.com/@latelateshow

Watch The Late Late Show with James Corden weeknights at 12:35 AM ET/11:35 PM CT on CBS and streaming on Paramount+.


---
Each week night, THE LATE LATE SHOW with JAMES CORDEN throws the ultimate late night after party with a mix of celebrity guests, edgy musical acts, games and sketches. Corden differentiates his show by offering viewers a peek behind-the-scenes into the green room, bringing all of his guests out at once and lending his musical and acting talents to various sketches. Additionally, bandleader Reggie Watts and the house band provide original, improvised music throughout the show. Since Corden took the reigns as host in March 2015, he has quickly become known for generating buzzworthy viral videos, such as Carpool Karaoke."
metadata.author: The Late Late Show with James Corden

metadata.title: The Final Episode - FULL - The Late Late Show with James Corden
metadata.description:
More than 8 years after our premiere, we say goodbye to The Late Late Show with James Corden in our final episode with guests Harry Styles and Will Ferrell. Please enjoy in full and thank you for sharing in so many memories with us.

More Late Late Show:

TikTok: http://https://www.tiktok.com/@latelateshow

Watch The Late Late Show with James Corden weeknights at 12:35 AM ET/11:35 PM CT. Only on CBS.

Get new episodes of shows you love across devices the next day, stream live TV, and watch full seasons of CBS fan favorites anytime, anywhere with CBS All Access. Try it free! http://bit.ly/1OQA29B

Each week night, THE LATE LATE SHOW with JAMES CORDEN throws the ultimate late night after party with a mix of celebrity guests, edgy musical acts, games and sketches. Corden differentiates his show by offering viewers a peek behind-the-scenes into the green room, bringing all of his guests out at once and lending his musical and acting talents to various sketches. Additionally, bandleader Reggie Watts and the house band provide original, improvised music throughout the show. Since Corden took the reigns as host in March 2015, he has quickly become known for generating buzzworthy viral videos, such as Carpool Karaoke."

metadata.title: Tom Cruise & James Join 'The Lion King' Cast
metadata.description:
After skydiving and flying in a fighter jet together, James is ready for a different kind of adventure with Tom Cruise and invites him to the historic Pantages Theater in Los Angeles to join the cast of "The Lion King" live on stage for one night. Tom may be the biggest action movie star in the world, but is he ready for "Hakunah Matata" on the boards?

metadata.title: We've Known Billie Eilish for 6 Years
metadata.description:
James welcomes his guests Billie Eilish and Natalie Portman, who just scored some serious points with her daughter who got to meet Billie before the show. metadata.title: There's Only 12 of These Left...
metadata.description:
There's just 12 episodes of The Late Late Show, and a primetime special, left and James gives us a taste of what we can expect for the final stretch.. And fresh off a break for Passover and Easter, a debate broke out in the office today: is ham a traditional Easter food? The news brings us headlines about a DoD leak, a new White House Easter Bunny, former President Donald Trump at the UFC fight and Fyre Festival II.

metadata.title: Tilly & Adele Have Gordon Ramsay Considering 'Dancing' & Singing
metadata.description:
Gordon Ramsay talks about watching his daughter Tilly compete on "Strictly Come Dancing" and it led to him entertaining a "Dancing with the Stars" appearance. Adam Pally talks about his experience working with Arnold Schwarzenegger. And Gordon tells us about his show "Next Level Chef" before James asks Gordon about seeing Adele in Las Vegas. And while Gordon may want to dance, singing is definitely not in his future.

metadata.title: Corruption is Rampant in Top Candy Bars List
metadata.description:
Tonight starts off with some questions about modern-day pro wrestling: Do they still do tag teams? Who are Doink and Dink? What would your wrestling name be? Thankfully James, aka Mr. Cheese, and Ian, aka Dr. Dreidel, are here to answer. In the news, the FBI didn’t find classified documents during a recent raid at President Biden’s vacation home in Delaware. Tom Brady has announced his retirement from the NFL, for real this time. And a recent list of the top 5 candy bars only includes American candies, which causes an uproar among the crew while they defend their favorite chocolate treats from across the pond.

metadata.description:
Sally Field is on the show and James is inspired to help her earn a GRAMMY to complete her EGOT. A flat news jingle has James concerned for Steve. And in the news, COVID sounds like it will be over in May. James responds to a Donald Trump lawsuit against our parent company, Paramount. And a story about a boy who ordered $1,000 of food on his parents' delivery app takes us down a journey that ends with Ian recalling how he once ordered $90 of Taco Bell.

metadata.title: Take Gwyneth Paltrow Back to the '90s
metadata.description:
James welcomes his guests Gwyneth Paltrow and Hilary Swank who is pregnant with twins and hitting her third trimester! Gwyneth shares how she's not prepared to have both of her kids in college soon. Hilary, now fully settled into life in Colorado, shares her plans to transition from plane to bus for getting back to Los Angeles. And Gwyneth longs for the 90s, a time before smartphones captured everything we do, before she talks about her new podcast series "The goop Pursuit" on audible.

metadata.title: Prince Harry Gave a Spicy Tell-All
metadata.description:
It's our first show of 2023 and we've got star power with Hilary Swank and Gwyneth Paltrow on as guests. After James gets a text from Gwyneth, he starts to wonder what his lifestyle brand would look like. And we catch up on a whole bunch of news, including President Biden heading to the Three Amigos summit, Kevin McCarthy having to try 15 times to get his Speaker of the House title and Brazil pulling its own January 6. And James reviews the highlights of Prince Harry's tell-all interview ahead of his book, "Spare."

-Welcome, everybody.

Indeed. -A lot of people

the first U.S. city to introduce

a swear jar in Brooklyn. -Ooh.

the toll is over $20. Yeah, or if you've got $20, you can just walk

[ Laughter ] [ Mumbles ] Listen to this.

broom closet to hide from Elon. And Melania was like,

Trump and Elon went from "Love Is Blind"
to "Baby Reindeer." You know what I'm saying? Some more political news --
today, Congress convened
to certify the results of the presidential election, and Vice President Harris
oversaw the process. Yeah, Harris was like, "And with that,
my Dry January is over." [ Laughter ] Even more upsetting,
a confused Biden then walked in and sang her "Happy Birthday." [ Mumbled singing ] You go, "Get him out of here.

the 119th Congress was officially sworn in,

of the House of Representatives. We thought we'd take
a minute to get to know some of them right now.
-Oh. -Yeah. For instance, here's
Mike Haridopolos... [ Laughter ] Up next, here's
George Latimer... [ Laughter ] Up next here is Bob Onder... [ Laughter ] Next up here is Brad Knott... [ Laughter ] Up next, here's Rob Bresnahan... [ Laughter ] Next up, here's --

-Wow! -Here's Riley Moore... [ Laughter ] And finally,
here's Pat Harrigan... [ Laughter ] It's good to get to know some

and understand them. [ Applause ] Yeah, guys, the 119th
Congress just kicked off. It's a brand-new group
of people. But luckily,
Mark's made a quick song to help us get to know them all. Mark, take it away. -Thanks, Jimmy. The 119th Congress is
an amazing group. They come from all
over the country, and every single one
of them is unique. Let's do this.
[ Up-tempo music plays ] ♪ The 119th Congress
has finally begun ♪ ♪ Let's get to know the members,
come on, it will be fun ♪ ♪ There's Mike and Mike
and Mike and Mike ♪ ♪ And Michael but he goes
by Mike ♪ ♪ There's Mike and Mike
and Mike and Mike ♪ -Wait, wait, hang on, hang on,
hang on, sorry, sorry, sorry. Is this real?
All those guys are named Mike? -Yep. -How many Mikes are in Congress? -26.
[ Laughter ] -Skip ahead of the song
a little bit there maybe, right? -This is textbook Mike erasure,
but sure. Hit it!
[ Up-tempo music plays ] ♪ The 119th Congress
minus all the Mikes ♪ ♪ Let's meet the other members ♪ ♪ I'm sure you're really
psyched ♪ ♪ There's John and John and John
and John and Jon without an H ♪ ♪ There's John and John
and John and John and ♪ -Hey, hey, sorry, sorry,
okay, okay. I think we -- I think we --
I think we get it. -Do you? Because guess who they elected
to be their leader, Jimmy. -Oh, my gosh.
-Mike John-son. [ Cheers and applause ]
-Yeah. Thank you. Mark Kelley, everyone.
Mark Kelley. Give it a -- Wow. [ Cheers and applause ]
Wow. Wow. A lot of Mikes. -Learning. -Hey, did you guys see this?
Today Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau
announced his resignation. He resigned at 11:00 a.m.
He's just like all of us. He got back from vacation. Then after one hour of work,
he's like, "I'm out." [ Laughter ] And finally,
Krispy Kreme and Pop-Tarts are collaborating
on a new doughnut collection. [ Audience oohs ] They're the only ones
listening to everyone's New Year's resolution and
thinking, "Not on our watch." We have a great show. Give it up for The Roots,
everybody. ♪♪ -♪ Yes, we back ♪ ♪♪ -What a show! Be sure to also
stick around all week long. We've got some great
shows coming up. Pamela Anderson will be
here tomorrow. Jamie Lee Curtis will be
on the show, and on Thursday we have
Cameron Diaz and Jamie Foxx. Can't wait for that.
That's a big show. But first, what a show
we have for you tonight. He's a talented actor. I love this guy, man.
He's just great and also great sense
of humor as well. -Super funny.
-Yeah. Super talented. He's also the host of
"Deal or No Deal Island." Season two premieres
tomorrow at 8:00 p.m. on NBC. And apparently something big
happens. -Ooh!
-Like something crazy. -Something crazy?
-Historic. -Historically crazy? -I'm going to talk to him

Busta Rhymes is here tonight! [ Cheers and applause ] Come on! Guys, I didn't do -- I didn't do
my -- I did my Wordle this morning, but I didn't do

-I didn't do -- Do you guys mind if we do
Connections together right now? Is that okay?
It's my favorite puzzle. I love doing it. It's time for
"Tonight Show Connections." Here we go. Let's do it. -♪ Tonight Show Connections ♪ ♪ La la la la la, oh, yeah ♪ -So the way it works, there are

I see black. -Uh-huh.
-I see yellow. -Yes.
-Brown and red. -Okay. Of course.
-Karate belts. Right?
-What? -It's in karate.
-Oh, karate belts. -Yeah.
-Oh. -What did you think it was?
-Colors. -Oh.
[ Laughter ] -No. You're -- Yeah,
that's right, karate belts. That's good.
Let's see what it is. [ Ding! ]
Yeah. Colors of
the New York City snow. -Oh.
[ Cheers and applause ] -I was close.
Yeah. It's a match. So we got it. It wasn't --
It wasn't karate belts. That was a good connection.
Interesting. Yeah. You got one, Quest?
-Yeah, I think so. We got, uh -- What? McDonald's, Wendy's,
Burger King, and Arby's. -Yeah. Okay, good. That's obviously...
-Fast-food restaurants. -Yeah. Of course.
-Yeah. -Let's see what it is. [ Ding! ] Required experience

[ Laughter and applause ] Either way, it's a match.
-Hey, it's a win. -Tariq, you want to play? -Okay, cool. -What do you got?
-Drano, Windex.
-Yeah. -Lysol and Tide.

Oh, it is. [ Ding! ] What people drink

[ Laughter ] -Wow.
[ Applause ] -Alright, so that

Jimmy. 50 years as

-That's unbelievable. -10 years.
[ Cheers and applause ] -50 years. I remember being a kid
and watching you. -No, you don't.
[ Laughter ] -Being like, "Oh, my God,
I'm going to do that." -No, no, you never -- Did you enjoy

one brand would be like, "Maybe someone else
has thought of using Tom Brady"? -Yes.
-It was -- But it was amazing. -Same people were
in everything. But I thought you'd be
excited about it because I know you played

-Look at that stud. Come on.
What, are you kidding me? [ Cheers and applause ]
Great photo. -This is my brother.
We both played. I mean, I played for like -- I mean, some of it is I played
Division III for a year. And, you know, because of the Internet, it
looks like I was a total jock, but I really --
-That counts. That helped me --
-Just the fact that you got dressed up makes it count,
Jim. -It does count, right?
-It totally counts. -I look like -- You know,
look at me. I had hair. It was nice.
-No. And also, I want to congratulate
you on "Saturday Night Live," by the way. You were
unbelievable as Tim Walz. [ Cheers and applause ]

-That was -- Thank you.
[ Cheers and applause ] -What was it like? I didn't want to bother you

Were you -- -Oh, my gosh, it was so amazing. It's like you're invited to,
like, graduate school at Harvard,
you know? -Yeah.
-Participating on "SNL." And then they pull
in all these MVPs. And so I was just --
I was kind of blown away. But it was amazing. And it was so fun

I grew up in the Midwest, so I just did an impression

-Perfect. -Who's a sweet guy who is

they were like, "You're good," you know?
-Wow. -It was perfect.
-That never happens. Yeah. The last time
we hung out together, hopefully you remember this. I will never forget this.
We met the Pope. -Yes. The Pope. Unbelievable.
The Pope invited comedians... -To the Vatican.
-...to the Vatican. Throughout the world --
I don't, you know. -This is real. -That shows you where the
Catholic Church is at right now. -Here's you shaking hands. -No, it was amazing. And it was --
[ Laughter and applause ] -This is me. -It was --
[ Cheers and applause ] It was --
-We met the Pope. -What you have to understand is there was this room
filled with comedians throughout the world. It's almost like all the people that couldn't behave
in church or synagogue... [ Laughter ] ...or a mosque had to see
the principal. -Yes.
-And it was so amazing. It was like 6:00 in the morning. And the Pope did say, you know, that humor is really important,
which was beautiful. And I think --
I don't know about you, but like, I'm kind of like,
"Yeah, that's really nice to hear, but I just do it because
I like attention, you know?" -Yeah, yeah.
[ Laughter ] -But it was pretty special,
right? And as a Catholic kid --
You grew up Catholic, right? -Yeah. Of course.
-It's a huge thing. And you do feel like,
as a Catholic or even a lapsed Catholic, you're jumping the line because
there are such sincere Catholics that know what's going on. Like, to this day, I'm in church and I've been going for,
I don't know, 58 years. And I'm like,
"Oh, now we stand up?" [ Laughter ]
I still don't know. -I still don't know the rules. I don't know the rules.
I guess we're all kneeling. I guess we're kneeling.
-Alright, we're doing this now? -We're doing this. Yeah. -You know, so, but it's amazing. -It was always great.
It was great to see you. And I kept looking over at you,

No, there's something wrong. -Yes. There's something wrong.
It was great. And how's the family doing?
-Good. Good. Good. You know, I'm still recovering

I mean glug-glug spirit. -Okay. Yeah, yeah, of course.
[ Laughter ] -But after you glug-glug,

together.
-Yeah. -But I, you know,
it's so fun doing these shows. And since I've gotten into it,
you know, Kentucky and Tennessee
and North Carolina, Texas, it's just -- there's
amazing distilleries out there and people have to go
and buy your local bourbon. You got to check it out. There's some great stuff
out there. -Support the bourbons
out there. Yeah. Why not? Let's talk about
your very funny special. It's called "The Skinny." In part, it's
because you talk in the special how you lost a lot of weight.
-Well, you know, I mean, I think it's such
an interesting thing to say I lost it because I, you know,
I'm on an appetite suppressant, so I didn't have anything
to do with it. [ Laughter ]
I shouldn't get any credit. It's a little bit like when, like, we compliment
supermodels for being beautiful. It's like they were
just born that way, right? And so I love the fact
that I've lost weight, but it's, you know, essentially, this drug has made me
eat like a human, you know, whereas before I would eat
like a dog. You know?
[ Laughter ] -Really?
-You know, like, if you give a dog --
if you leave the dog food out, the dog will eat
the entire bag of food. And that's like me, you know? -Yeah, well, it's doing
a great job, but I want to show a clip
of your stand-up. It's very good. Here's Jim Gaffigan
in "The Skinny." Take a look at this. -Parenting teenagers
has made me a better comedian. No, that's not it. [ Laughter ] A bitter comedian.
[ Laughter ] I know that sounds negative, but it is almost sad when
a kid becomes a teenager, right? Because you have this cute
12-year-old and then boom, they become Satan.
[ Laughter ] You can literally witness
the curiosity and wonder transform into body odor
and poor judgment. [ Laughter ] And then you, the parent, you're supposed to learn
how to communicate with them! My wife e-mails me articles
"how to talk to your teenager." I'm like, "Delete." [ Laughter and applause ] -Jim Gaffigan, everybody. "The Skinny" is streaming now
on Hulu. More "Tonight Show"
after the break. Stick around.

metadata.description:
Ariana Grande and Kelly Clarkson go mic-to-mic in a Mixtape Medley showdown singing their rendition of popular songs from iconic pop divas such as Alanis Morissette, Céline Dion and Whitney Houston.

All episodes of That’s My Jam are streaming now on Peacock! https://pck.tv/433zkSK

ABOUT THAT’S MY JAM 
Hosted by Jimmy Fallon, “That’s My Jam” is an hour long music and comedy variety game show that draws inspiration from the most popular “Tonight Show” games. Each episode features two teams of two celebrities competing for a charity of their choice in a series of music, dance, and trivia-based games and musical performances. Signature games to be played include Launch the Mic, Air Guitar, Don’t Drop the Beat, Perfect Mash-Up, Wheel of Impossible Karaoke, Slay It, Don’t Spray It and many more. 

The format was brought to Universal Television Alternative Studio by Fallon, longtime “The Tonight Show” producer Jim Juvonen and writer Josh Knapp. Adam Blackstone is Musical Director and will lead the house band throughout each episode. Mike Yurchuk will serve as showrunner.

come on ♪ ♪ All those things

leavin' soon ♪ ♪ So keep dancin' ♪ -[ Shouts ]
-♪ Unh, break it down ♪ -♪ Got this feeling in my body ♪
-♪ Yeah ♪ -♪ Got this feeling in my body ♪
-♪ Ooh-ohh ♪ -♪ Got this feeling in my body ♪
-♪ Said I got this feeling ♪ -♪ Got this feeling in my body ♪ ♪ Uh-huh ♪ [ All cheering ]

-Welcome, welcome,
welcome to "The Tonight Show." You're here. You made it.
Thank you for watching. Guys, it is that time
of year again. Tomorrow is Santacon. [ Cheers and applause ] That's right.
Here in New York City, thousands of people
will dress up as Santa and pack the streets
for an all-day bar crawl. Yep.
[ Laughter ] Things kick off in Midtown
at 10 a.m. and then end asleep
on a sidewalk, spooning a trash bag
at 2 p.m.. So you're gonna want
to wake the kids for that one.
That's right. Thousands in Midtown
will be dressed in red suits and begin drinking
at 10 a.m. Right now, Times Square Elmo is
like, "Oh, sure, but when I do it..." Some political news tonight.
President Biden was in LA for a campaign fundraiser
with Steven Spielberg. Yeah, Biden knows
Spielberg's work well. Anytime his staff
brings his poll numbers, he hears the theme from "Jaws." Of course,
because it's Hollywood. Biden won't admit his approval
rating is shrinking. He just says
it's on Ozempic. Speaking of Biden,
earlier today, he announced
the largest investment in passenger rail transportation
since the creation of Amtrak. The largest investment
since the creation of Amtrak, which is big for Biden
because he was there for the creation of the wheel. Yeah, Biden just announced
a massive new rail investment, and we actually got
our hands on the message Biden recorded that
they're playing on every train in the country
starting today. Yeah. Check this out. -I think that's fantastic. What? Come on.
-Pocket full of salamanders? -Yeah. Pocket full
of salamanders. That's right. Well, people are talking
about this. Last night, Hunter Biden was
indicted on nine tax charges. Yeah, in a 56-page indictment, he's accused of dodging
federal taxes, making false payments
on Venmo, and fraud. Well, when asked
how he feels about Hunter not paying his taxes, President Biden said
it is very disappointing. While former President
Trump said... Next, when asked how he feels
about Hunter Venmoing $1,500 to an exotic dancer, President Biden
said it's irresponsible, while Trump said... And finally, when asked if
he'd consider pardoning Hunter, President Biden said no.
Trump said... -What? Wow. -Some news from overseas. I saw that Vladimir Putin
announced that he's running
for president of Russia again. Wow. I don't want to say
their elections are phony, but on their "I voted" stickers,
the word "voted" is in quotes. Some business news -- Krispy Kreme just opened their
first French location in Paris. Finally, a place to get
decent pastry in Paris. [ Laughter ] You guys see this?
Pantone just announced their 2024 color of the year
is Peach Fuzz. Yeah. Can we see
a picture of Peach Fuzz? Hey, that's why I --
Come on! Hey! Hey, why -- [ Cheers and applause ] -Hey. -Uh, well, this is wild. Authorities at an airport
in Thailand caught a man smuggling
two otters and a prairie dog
in his pants. Not much you can really do
after that other than yell, "Ta da!"
I mean, really? Well, get this. I read about
a couple in Florida who got married while
going through a car wash. Good thing about getting
married in a car wash is that the 10th one's free. -Finally, guys,
we have exactly 11 shows left before we go
on Christmas break, which means it's time
for that beloved "Tonight Show" tradition. It's time for 12 Days
of Christmas Sweaters. -♪ 12 days of Christmas
sweaters ♪ ♪ 11 days left ♪ [ Cheers and applause ] -That's right. Every show between now
and Christmas, we'll be giving
one lucky audience member a bodacious
Christmas sweater from the countdown
to Christmas cabinet. Since there are 11 shows left,
let's open door number 11. [ Cheers and applause ] ♪♪ Oh. ♪♪ [ Cheers and applause ] That's nice.
Thank you very much. Now let's see who's going home
with tonight's sweater. Everyone look
at your seat number. I need you to jump up
and let me know where you are if you get --
if I say your number. Quest,
can I get a drum roll, please? Who wants me
to pick their number? This is good. ♪♪ -448. ♪♪ [ Cheers and applause ] ♪♪ ♪♪ -Alright. Oh, man. ♪♪ Here we go. We can do a little --
Come over here. Gosh. How are you? Barely made it
on the standby line there, huh? Uh, you don't want to come down
one step towards me? Come on. Gosh, I just walked up --
How you doing? -Hi. Hi, I'm Mark.
-Oh, what is -- -What is your name?
-Mark. -Yeah. Uh, Mark,
where are you from? -I'm from Spain.
-Hey. Welcome.
Thank you for being here. Mark, it gets a little chilly
sometimes in Spain, correct? -Yeah. It is.
-Yeah. Cold. Right? I mean, you have this.
This is very nice. I love this fleece.
Whatever it is, it's gorgeous. Do you have anything like this?
-No, I don't, I don't, I don't. -Have you ever seen
anything like this? -No.
-No, never. Would you like to try it on? -Yeah, sure.
-Yeah, I think you should. You can put it over that. I want to make it
as uncomfortable as possible. [ Cheers and applause ] ♪♪ And this is the front.
This is the front, I think. The good thing
about this sweater is there's no front or back. You just put it on and hope
for the best, you know? Oh, this is great, Mark.
Yeah. Oh, yeah. That's right. Oh, wow. He made it through.
He made it through. Look at that.
That looks fantastic. Look at how good you look.
Fantastic, buddy. -Thank you.
-Welcome. Thank you for being here. Enjoy. Happy holidays, buddy.
-Thank you. -Give it up for Mark, everybody. Stick around.
When we come back, we're doing something fun
with Anne Hathaway.

-Welcome, everybody. Welcome, welcome,
welcome to "The Tonight Show." You're here. You made it.
Thank you for watching. [ Cheers and applause ] Guys, it is the holiday season, and today, it even started
snowing here in New York. [ Cheers and applause ] Yeah, it was just a few flakes, but LaGuardia
shut down immediately. Well, here's some fun
local news. You guys aren't
going to believe this. A guy in Brooklyn
just won $10 million from a scratch-off ticket
for the second year in a row. Yeah, he's loving life today. He marched into his old job
like, "I quit again!" Well, guys, everyone is
talking about this. Last night in Alabama,
four candidates took the stage for another Republican
presidential debate. Yep. The big winners from
the night were Nikki Haley, Chris Christie, and everyone who decided
not to watch. Yeah, last night was
the fourth Republican debate. At this point, it's kind of
like "Indiana Jones" movies. Three was enough.
You know what I'm saying? Once again, the debate
was kind of crazy. People are saying it was
pretty controversial when Vivek Ramaswamy
held up a sign that said "Nikki=corrupt." -Ooh! -I don't think that that's
controversial. I mean, I think it would be
really controversial if he held up a sign
that said... I mean, because that's --
People are -- That is not --
A hot dog is a hot dog. Meanwhile, Chris Christie
came out swinging and went after Ramaswamy
and he really didn't hold back. Watch this. For real. -You do this at every debate.
-I'll say exactly -- -No, don't interrupt me.
I didn't interrupt you. This is the fourth debate,
the fourth debate that you would be voted,
in the first 20 minutes, as the most obnoxious
blowhard in America. So shut up for a --
[ Cheers and applause ] -Wow. Wow! It is clear Ramaswamy
isn't well-liked. After he attacked Christie, the moderators were like,
"Governor Christie, you have two hours to respond." At another point
during the debate, Chris Christie said
the other candidates were afraid to mention Trump
and treat him like Voldemort, he who must not be named. And that got me thinking. There's actually
a lot of similarities between Republicans
and Harry Potter. -Oh, boy. Here we go. -What's up, Tariq?
-Well, let me guess. You're going to show,
like, a bunch of side-by-side photos of Republicans
and then the Harry Potter -- like, the characters
that they look like. -Yeah, that was the plan. -Well, I know exactly
how this will go. So, first, you'll show
a picture of Harry Potter, and then you'll say he looks
like House Speaker Mike Johnson. And then, after that,
you'll show a picture of -- I don't know --
probably Draco Malfoy, and you'll say he looks
like Eric Trump. And then, finally, after that,
you'll show a picture of -- I don't know -- like,
Neville Longbottom when he got frozen,
and then, boom, there he is, Mitch McConnell. Is that how this is going to go? -I mean, yeah, yeah,
that was pretty good, but you're a little off. Yeah. Because, first,
I'd show Harry Potter, but then I'd say he looks
like George Santos. Then, after that,
I'd show Draco's dad, Lucius Malfoy,
and say he looks like Marjorie Taylor Greene. And, finally, I'd show
frozen Neville Longbottom, but he's more like Ron DeSantis
trying to stand normally. -I got to give it to you, man.
-Yeah? [ Cheers and applause ] That's right, everybody. The debate lasted two hours,
and a lot happened, so it was honestly hard
to keep up. Thankfully, we have a remix
to help you out. Check it out. -Let's get started.
[ Hip-hop music playing ] -Nikki is corrupt. -It's not worth my time
to respond. -That's not true. -Don't interrupt me.
I didn't interrupt you. -I have a woman problem. -The most obnoxious
blowhard in America. -Walk yourself off that stage,
enjoy a nice meal. -Don't interrupt me.
I didn't interrupt you. -They all had man dresses on. -Get the hell out of this race. -Don't interrupt me.
I didn't interrupt you. -Thanks for watching.
Thank you, guys. -There you go.
Just a little remix. [ Cheers and applause ] -Well, switching gears, guys,
this is very sweet. Apparently,
every year for Christmas, President Biden
gives his wife, Jill, a personal poem
that he's written. -Aww!
-Isn't that cute? Yeah, and this year,
he's been writing a bunch, trying to find
the right one to give. And we actually got a hold
of the wastebasket from the Oval Office
that has some of the rejects. Should I read
some of them right now? -I would, yeah.
-This is the official waste... -Wow!
-...of the Oval Office. James, can I get some
poem-reading music, please? [ Soft music plays ] Oh, that's perfect. Sweet, right? This one here.
How about this one? Oh! -He really crumpled them up.
-This says... -Aww!
-Isn't that sweet? -That's cute.
-It's cute. He did crumble them up.
He did crumble them all up. Yeah.
-Really hard. -Yeah. Well, he probably
shoots them in the basket. -Yeah, probably did that
from a long distance. So, I mean, that's... -Oh, there's another one.
-Yeah. -He wrote a lot of these.
-Yeah. Oh, this is nice. Well, it's close. He's cl--
-He's close. -He means well. This is the last one here.
-Wow, that one looks glued. There you go. That's fantastic.
Isn't that nice? That's cute. Merry Christmas, everybody.
[ Cheers and applause ] We got the wastebasket.
-Wow. That's so great you got that.
-Yeah. You guys see this? A new poll found that
New York City Mayor Eric Adams' approval rating is at 28%, which is the lowest
in that poll's history. Yeah, he's pretty unpopular. Check out this news thing
I saw, local news. -Mayor Eric Adams' approval
rating is now at a record low, according to a recent poll. To put that in perspective,
he's now less popular than... and even... -Oh, my God!
That was in the local news. [ Cheers and applause ] Hey... -Hey! -Switching gears, I read that,
on a recent flight from Canada, an off-duty pilot had to step in after the captain suffered
an uncontrollable nosebleed. Yeah. This is why
before I board a plane, I always double-check that
the pilot's not a third grader. [ Laughter ] And this made things worse. Instead of tilting his head back
to stop the bleeding, he tilted the plane. -Oh.
-Yeah, it was... Guys, finally, we have
exactly 12 shows left before we go on Christmas break,
which means it's time for that beloved "Tonight Show"
tradition. It's time for
"12 Days of Christmas Sweaters"! -♪ "12 Days of
Christmas Sweaters" ♪ ♪ 12 days left ♪ -That's right. Every show between
now and Christmas, we will be giving
one lucky audience member a spectacular Christmas sweater from the Countdown
to Christmas Cabinet. Since there are 12 shows left,
let's open door number 12. [ Drumroll ] Whoa! [ Cheers and applause ]
♪♪ Wow. This is gorgeous.
Look at this. I don't know what that is.
Holy moly. Alright, now let's see who's going home with
tonight's sweater. Everyone look
at your seat number, okay? If I call your number,
I need you to jump up and let me know where you are. Quest, can I get
a drumroll, please? [ Drumroll ] Who wants me
to pick their number? It's a good sweater. [ Cheers and applause ] 442! [ Cheers and applause ]
♪♪ Hi! How you doing?
-Good. How are you? -I'm fantastic. What is your name
and where are you from? -Maria from Colombia.
-Maria from Colombia! Oh, my goodness. Maria, you have
a beautiful sweater on. Does it get
a little chilly in Colombia? -Um, no.
-No. So this is perfect,
because those rare occasions when it does become chilly,
you're going to have something. Do you have anything like this?
-No. -No. Would you like to
try it on? -Of course.
-Oh, my God. Guys, give it up for
Maria from Colombia. [ Cheers and applause ] You got your gla-- Oh. -Thank you.
-No pr-- Oh, Maria, this is --
I mean, this is gor-- Look at this. That's gorgeous. Oh, you're a model.
Thank you so much. Give it up for Maria, everybody.
Thanks again. Stick around. We'll be
right back with Olivia Rodrigo!

-Rachel Zegler,
welcome to our show. We are big fans of yours
here at the show, so thank you so much
for coming on. I appreciate this.
-Thank you for having me. I'm so -- I can't even.
This is crazy. -Alright, good, good.
I'm excited. I have things I want
to ask about you. One is your name -- Rachel.
-Yes. -You got this -- You got your
name from someone very famous. And am I right?
-You are correct. I was named after
Rachel Green from "Friends." -Okay, good. Alright.
That is real? -That is real.
That is a real fact. And everybody --
Nobody ever believes me because they think
that there's no way I'm young enough
to be named after "Friends." But --
-No, you were. -But I am, yeah. My mom -- They were
going to name me Catherine, but my older sister's
Jacqueline, and they thought that might be too confusing
for babies to figure out. -Yeah. Catherine and Jacqueline.
Yeah. -Yeah. And, so, yeah,
my mom loved the way it sounded on "Friends"
for Jennifer Aniston, and then that was my name. -I mean, that's a perfect
person to be named -- We love -- Who doesn't love
Jennifer Aniston or Rachel? -I love Jennifer. -You could have been
named after the hairstyle. -I could have been Ross.
-You could have been Ross. -Who knows?
-You could have been Ross. Yeah, alright.
-All right, why not, right? -Ross Zegler's got a good name
to it, as well. -Yeah, right? -Well, if you want to have
a brother... I want to talk to you
about this, because I know you're a big --
You're a big Swiftie. -Yes.
-And you were at the... [ Cheers and applause ] I mean, how cool are you? -She looks very sad, but that was just
because I had food poisoning. -No.
-I did. -You did not.
-I did. You still went to the show.
-Oh, I would not have -- I sold my kidney to be there. -Really?
-Yeah. -You love her that much?
-I love her so much. -Back-in-the-day Swiftie?
-Yeah. From self-titled album, which we're still waiting
for the re-record of. [ Cheers and applause ] See? I found my people
in the audience. -Yeah, yeah, yeah. But do you -- Are you
one of those people at the concerts that yell out, "Oh, the next song
is going to be this or..." -Oh, I knew the set list,
I know the callbacks, and I was waiting
for the secret songs. -Secret songs.
-Yeah. -My best friend, Brenna, had gone in Atlanta,
before the MetLife show, and I went to MetLife Night 1. And she said --
-Whoo! -Thank you. And she said to my older sister,
Jacqueline, who I took to the show
with me -- She was like, "Jacqueline, if they play 'Getaway Car'
or 'Maroon,' she's on crisis watch." Not only did she play
"Getaway Car," she also played "Maroon." I was having a mental breakdown
in the audience at MetLife Stadium. -I love it. -Yeah.
And then Ice Spice came out. And I kept making the joke --
-That's right. -Exactly.
-I remember that. -Yeah.
-That was a big deal. -I was making a joke all night
to the girls behind me. Wherever they are,
they can attest to it. I kept making the joke that
Ice Spice was going to come out, not knowing anything about
that actually happening, and then it happened. -Wow. So you should
play the lottery that night. -Yeah.
-Anything you did came true. -My Swiftie manifestation
says "Reputation TV" is coming. [ Cheers and applause ] -Okay.
-Thank you. -Right now, let's talk
about "Hunger Games," okay? "The Ballad of Songbirds --"
Let's focus. The "Ballad of Songbirds
and Snakes." -Yes. -By the way, your character, Lucy Gray,
sings a lot in the film. -Yes, she does.
-Which is great. Which you did live on set.
-I did, yeah. -You can do it.
You know how to do it. I mean, I was reading somewhere, there was, like, inspirations
of Dolly Parton in there. -Yeah, yeah. Well, it's -- She's a very --
She's a country, folksy singer. And, so, Suzanne Collins,
who wrote the book -- she used to be
a country-music deejay. So she had this, like --
-Oh! -Yeah. And it's like
she has such a deep knowledge
of that whole world, which I really didn't know
too much about. -I didn't know
she was a country deejay. -I didn't either.
-That's fascinating. -Yeah. And so she's obsessed
with Dolly Parton, Patsy Cline, and then we kind of
based her voice off of that. -How cool.
-Yeah. -Well, the soundtrack --
it comes out this Friday, as well, with you
are featured on it. -Yeah. -And Olivia Rodrigo
is featured on the album. -Yeah. So everyone's
talking about this. -Yeah. -It's already got over
a million streams already. It's just crushing.
Congratulations. -Thank you. -And you accidentally
started a rumor, and I thought tonight
would be the perfect night for you to clear up this rumor. -It's time to address it.
Oh, my goodness. Yeah, I accidentally
started a rumor that Nicki Minaj
was on the album for "The Hunger Games: The Ballad
of Songbirds and Snakes." -That is not true.
-It's not true. She's not. She's releasing her album
on Friday, I believe. But it was one of those things where there's a character
named Barb Azure in the movie. And the actress who plays
Barb Azure has a great sense of humor. Her name is Honor Gillies.
She's so fantastic. And posted a video
of Nicki Minaj saying, "Calling all Barbs"
when she got cast. And her character plays
the stand-up bass in the movie. So, obviously, I commented,
"Slapping that super bass," as you would. -Yeah.
-Now, the Barbs got me good. They were screen-shotting
those comments, posting them
all over social media, being like,
"What is mother doing? They are very, very, very
dedicated and amazing. I am a Barb.
I love Nicki. -Yeah.
-But she's not on the album. But she started playing into it. She posted a TikTok
with "The Hanging Tree" song, saying like, "I have something
coming out November 17th." Like, she knew what
she was doing. I had no idea what I was doing.
-No idea what she was doing. No, no. You were just being you
and you go, "I didn't know. I'd even start this rumor." -And I didn't know if she
was on the soundtrack, so I was just
kind of like, "Okay." -And she's not.
-And she's not. -Okay, good.
I'm glad you said it. -Just me.
-Yeah. No, good. I'm glad. It's you and Olivia Rodrigo.
-Yeah. -We're happy.
-Yeah. -Okay, yeah, we're good.
-Thanks. -Do we set -- How do we set up
the movie "Hunger Games"? This is pre-Katniss.
-Set 64 years in the past. It's been 10 years
since the districts and The Capitol
have, like, gone to war. And the Hunger Games have been
going on for 10 years. -It's a giant,
giant, giant movie. And I would suggest go see it
in IMAX because it's just a lot. -And we did film it for IMAX.
It's the craziest experience. -Enjoy it.
I want to show everyone a clip. Here's Rachel Zegler
in "The Hunger Games: The Ballad of Songbirds
and Snakes." Take a look. -♪ This world, it's dark ♪ ♪ This world, it's scary ♪ ♪ I've taken some,
and so no wonder I'm weary ♪ ♪ It's why ♪ ♪ I need you ♪ ♪ You're as pure as
the driven snow ♪ [ Vocalizing ] ♪♪ -Whoo!
[ Cheers and applause ] Rachel Zegler! "The Hunger Games: The Ballad of
Songbirds and Snakes" is in theaters
and IMAX this Friday. Hi to Fiona?
-Hi to Fiona. -Hi to Fiona.
-Hi, Fiona! We'll be right back
with Tariq Trotter, everybody. Stick around.

all_transcripts.page_content:
-Thank you, thank you,
thank you, thank you, thank you, thank you, thank you.
Enjoy yourself, everybody. Welcome, welcome,
welcome to "The Tonight Show." You're here. You made it.
[ Cheers and applause ] Thank you for watching at home. Well, guys, last night
here on NBC was the third Republican
presidential debate, and it's being described
as "unhinged." [ Laughter ] Oh, yeah. There was name-calling,
wild rants, and personal attacks. Even Trump was watching
like, "Game recognizes game." [ Laughter ] "Game recognize game!" [ Laughter ] Yeah, it was vicious.
At one point, Lester Holt was like,
"We interrupt this debate with a 'Real Housewives' reunion
already in progress." [ Laughter ] It was quite a night.
During the two-hour debate, Nikki Haley got
the most questions, Tim Scott spoke the longest, and Ron DeSantis spoke
the [coughs] shortest. [ Laughter ] Yeah, one of the big moments
from the night was when Vivek Ramaswamy went
after Nikki Haley's daughter for being on TikTok.
Watch this. -I want to laugh
at why Nikki Haley didn't answer your question, which is about looking
at families in the eye. In the last debate,
she made fun of me for actually joining TikTok
while her own daughter was actually using the app
for a long time. So you might want to take care
of your family first. -Leave my daughter out
of your voice. -Adult daughter. The next generation
of Americans are using it. Here's the truth.
-You're just scum. -The easy answer... [ Audience "Oohs" ]
-Ooh. -Then the moderator tried
to calm things down, and he was like,
"Nikki, Vivek, remember, none of you
are going to be president." [ Laughter ] "Just want to --
Just calm it down." [ Cheers and applause ]
"Calm down." Not only did the attack
backfire for Vivek, it also went viral on TikTok. [ Laughter ] And get this.
For a while now, Tim Scott has claimed
to have a girlfriend, but no one has ever seen her, and donors have been worried
it's hurting him in the race. So, after the debate,
he brought her up on stage. Yeah. When asked how they met,
she was like, "I was his Uber driver
on the way over here." [ Laughter ] Smart move by Tim Scott. He's probably not
gonna be president, but at least people know
that he has a fake girlfriend. So that's good.
[ Laughter ] "She lives in Canada.
You guys don't know her." [ Laughter ] "She doesn't go to school here." [ Laughter ] Meanwhile, former president
Trump didn't attend the debate and said held his own rally
just a few miles away. It was the first time
a Trump rally was the less chaotic
Republican event. During the rally,
Trump said Republicans should stop wasting time
on debates. Then he said, "And let's also
stop wasting time on elections and just declare me
the winner, okay? Come on."
[ Laughter ] Switching gears, you guys,
here's some great news. After 118 days,
the Screen Actors Guild reached a deal with
the Hollywood studios. The strike is over! [ Cheers and applause ] -So, tune in tomorrow
when my guests will be everyone. [ Laughter ] Uh, yes, interesting that the -- [ Cheers and applause ] ♪♪ Oh, my gosh.
Whoa. The guys from
Please Don't Destroy. Oh, my gosh.
[ Cheers and applause ] Welcome.
What are you guys doing here? Shouldn't you be up at "SNL"? -Dude, I'll tell you
what we're doing here. -What?
-We were on the show three days ago,
and we couldn't talk about our movie
'cause of the actors strike. -Yeah, but now it's over,
and we can talk about it. So why don't you book us? -What do you mean,
why don't we book you? You were just here. -Yeah, but we weren't able
to talk about our movie. "Please Don't Destroy:
The Treasure of Foggy Mountain," coming out on Peacock.
-Yeah, well... [ Cheers and applause ] Well, you come back,
and you can talk about it. -Who do you have booked tonight?
-We're fully booked. We have Jared Leto
on the show tonight. [ Cheers and applause ] -Well, what movie
does he have coming out? -He's not talking
about a movie. He's announcing a world tour
with Thirty Seconds to Mars. -So he's not talking about "Please Don't Destroy:
The Treasure of Foggy Mountain," coming out
November 17th on Peacock? -No, he's not talking about it. -Oh, okay.
-Okay. Who else is on the show? -AJR is on the show tonight. [ Cheers and applause ] -Oh. So AJR is going to talk about "Please Don't Destroy:
The Treasure of Foggy Mountain," coming out on peacock.com November 17th?
You can sign up today. -Uh, no, AJR is not going to
talk about that at all. They're a great band,
and they have a new album coming out tonight --
at midnight, actually. Tonight. Yeah.
-Wow. So then... [ Cheers and applause ] I mean, I just don't understand how the hell anyone
is going to find out about "Please Don't Destroy:
The Treasure of Foggy Mountain," which is coming out, uh,
November 17th on Peacock. [ Laughter ] -Yeah, I don't know
how that's going to happen. I'm sorry.
I'm sorry to let you down. -Okay. Alright. We're gonna
go do "Seth." Um... -Wow.
-Before -- Before we leave,
we just want to say this audience is
the best audience in the world! -Get out of here! -Love you, Jimmy. -Bye, guys. Get out of here! [ Cheers and applause ] Get out of here!
Please Don't Destroy! Please Don't Destroy. No one's gonna talk
about it. The strike is... [ Laughs ] That's just so funny. Guys, anyway, as I was saying,
the strike is finally over. That's right. When the actors
heard a deal had been reached, they gasped, screamed,
laughed, cried, and then were like,
"I also do accents." [ Laughter ] Seriously, the actors are back
just in time. I'm not sure the world
could handle another reality dating show.
Am I right? [ Laughter, audience groans ] Speaking of --
[ Laughter ] Like, you recognize
maybe two of those. Come on.
[ Laughter ] Speaking of, tonight was the
"Women Tell All" episode of "The Golden Bachelor." -Ooh.
[ Audience "Oohs" ] -Yeah.
'Cause who doesn't love hearing their grandma
describe sex? [ Laughter ] -Oy!
-"You pulled the muscle in the fantasy suite? I pulled a muscle
in the fantasy suite." [ Laughter ] You guys see this?
Starting next month, Disney+ and Hulu are going
to be merged into the same app. -Ooh.
-Yep, streamers are merging. Pretty soon, they're
gonna be all in one giant app called cable. [ Laughter ] What are we doing?
What are we doing? [ Applause ] What have we done?
-Come on. -Yep. Disney+ and Hulu
are merging into one app. That's good.
Now, when your kid tries to turn on "Bluey," he'll wind
up bingeing "Sons of Anarchy." [ Laughter ] Hey, it's good to see you, bud. I feel like we haven't
caught up in a while. -Oh, wow.
I'm good. Thanks for checking in, buddy. -[ Chuckles ]
What have you been up to lately? -Not much.
Well, I was in Grand Rapids the other day.
-Oh. How was that? Good. Had a little trouble
getting an Uber, but I figured it out. -In Grand Rapids
over the weekend, an Amazon truck was stolen
and then taken on a joy ride. [ Laughter ] -What else have
you been up to? -You know, lots of travel. Check out this small town
called McKees Rocks. Just watch cars go by.
It was great. -Police in McKees Rocks
arrested a man they say was trying to expose himself
to passing drivers. [ Laughter ] -Sounds like you've been busy.
Anything else? -Let me think.
Um... Oh, I went to my house
in Connecticut, just west of Hartford.
Did some gardening -- Oh. So relaxing.
-In Burlington, Connecticut, west of Hartford,
a man is now charged with running
an illegal psychedelic mushroom growing operation
out of a house. [ Laughter and applause ] -Wow. You've had a lot
on your plate. -Yeah. Also, I went down
to my winter place. The Villages in Florida.
You know me. Work hard, play hard. -A man who lives
in The Villages was arrested by the feds, accused of having thousands of
dollars worth of illegal pills used to treat
erectile dysfunction. [ Laughter ] -Well, it was nice
catching up with you. -Hang on.
I'm on the phone with my doctor. Yeah, well, it's been way
longer than four hours. -All right, Steve Higgins,
everybody. Steve. [ Applause ] Guys, I heard about
two women in Michigan who are accused
of embezzling $20,000 from a Girl Scout troop. -Oh.
-$20,000. That's almost the amount
your co-worker guilts you into buying each year.
[ Laughter ] Apparently, one of the women
accused was like, "She did it. I was just a tagalong." [ Laughter ] -Come on! ♪♪ -Guys, listen to this.
A U.S.-bound flight from London had to turn around
after crew members realized that the plane
was missing two windows. [ Laughter ] Then they landed
and we were like, "Oh, crap. We're also missing
two passengers." [ Laughter ]

all_transcripts.page_content:
-Charli,
welcome back to the show. You look fantastic. Thank you
so much for coming back. -Thank you for having me. -The first time
you were here, I want to say, it was three
and a half years ago or something like that,
and we were talking. We're both excited because
you had 32 million followers and on TikTok, and it was like,
"Wow, that's awesome." Here we are. That's not that long ago,
three and a half years ago, you're at 151 million followers. [ Cheers and applause ] Is that crazy? -I mean, to me,
it's like, I can -- Like, this is a lot of people,
and I get so nervous. So to think that I actually post for that many people
is absolutely insane. -Yeah. -I can't really
understand it, but I feel like
it's better that way, because I can be less nervous. -Yeah. Well, how old are you
when you first started? -I was 15.
-15. -On the show last time,
I was 15. -Good for you, buddy.
That's so tough. I mean, you stayed strong. I mean, that must be
a lot of pressure, you know, to start a business
and keep going and and keep thinking of new ideas. And then you have the show, and now your whole family
is involved now. Do you ever go back
and watch your old TikToks? -I do and I make fun
of myself a lot because it is so embarrassing. But it's also fun
to go down memory lane and be like, "Oh, my goodness,
this outfit was atrocious, but, look, it was so cute. I was a baby." -Yeah, yeah. You still are.
You still are. I wanted to ask you something,
because I saw "Vanity Fair." They did a thing.
You did a lie-detector test. You know what I'm about to say?
-Mm-hmm. -Yeah, you love Dunkin' Donuts.
-I do. -Okay, well, let's just watch
this lie-detector test. -Do you actually like Dunkin'
as much as you say you do? -Yes, and I shamelessly
promote them so much. No, I'm such a fan
of Dunkin' Donuts. -I'm happy that they're doing,
like, cool stuff, though. -Do you think you like Dunkin'
more than this person? -Yes. -Do you know who that is?
-No. [ Laughter ] [ Cheers and applause ] -You don't know
who Ben Affleck is? -No, I do,
and I've, like, fully had conversations with him before. And, like, I know who --
That's why it's so unb-- My sister clowned me
for that so hard the entire ride back. I was so embarrassed.
-But that's hilarious. So like, "Yeah, I love --" "You like it better
than this person?" And you just blanked? -Because I just, like --
I know how much -- I've had two coffees
already today, you know? Like, I --
-Yes. You were in the zone
of Dunkin' Donuts. -I know how much I love it,
and it's more than... -Anyone.
-...anyone. -Yeah, including that person who, at the time,
you didn't know. -Now I've looked
at the photos, I feel like we can be equal. -Oh, my God. That's so funny. You were telling me
backstage, though, that you actually had a great
meeting with Jennifer Lopez... -Yeah. -...who is like --
Gosh, we have that in common. She is unbelievable.
We both love Jennifer Lopez. -I love her.
She was the absolute sweetest. Every single time
I've spoken to her, she, like,
can see inside my brain and tell me exactly
what I need to hear without even knowing. Like, genuinely,
my dream when I was younger was to be
a backup dancer for her. That was all that
I ever wanted in life. -Me too.
-I'm such a fan. We still can.
-We still can, yeah. Jennifer, if you're watching,
we're in. Yeah. -If you need us.
-She is just the best, right? She is a pro. When she comes on the show,
I mean, she -- Her in concert. Go -- If she tours again --
Well, she will. -But --
-She's insane. -A professional.
She puts the work in, man. -It's incredible.
-Yeah. I know Halloween is coming up, and you're a big fan
of Halloween. Can you say what
you're dressing up as? No? -I have, like, a list,
quite a long list, in my notes of --
I work on it all year long, add to it every week, you know? But, so far, I only have
like one or two locked down. I want to do Boo
from "Monsters, Inc.", because I have the bob,
and I feel like it just kind of works, you know? -Okay. That's good. -But, I mean, my boyfriend
and I were trying to do, like, cute couples costumes,
but we're so indecisive that we just, like,
can't actually get it together. -Yeah.
-We have time. -You do have a little time.
Yeah. Yeah. You have like a --
Yeah, you have like a week. You don't really have time,
to really be honest. Your career
has actually blown up. It's so cool to watch on TikTok. Now you turn it into
a business now. You have a shoe line. Talk about this.
How fun is that? -It's crazy. I mean,
all I really know about shoes is the fact
that I wear them every day, so I don't know
how it actually works, but we have such an amazing team
behind us that can, you know --
We're in heels a lot. There's three girls
in the family. We're all constantly, like,
blisters, everything hurts. So it's been really fun to take
my favorite parts of shoes and my least favorite parts of
shoes and work it all together and make them comfortable,
stylish, cute, get to pick the colors,
the shapes, the silhouettes, the styles. So it's really fun.
-I mean, you have everything. You have, like --
You have slides. You have sneakers.
I'm like, it's so -- Actually,
you wore them in today. I was like, "You should just
wear them out with your dress. Why not?" They're, like --
They're cute sneakers. But that's wild that you go,
"Yeah, I had this idea and I'm going to make it real." And you're making
all this stuff a reality. -I know. It's insane.
-I'm so happy for you, buddy. -Thank you!
-Really. I'm a big... [ Cheers and applause ] And the show,
"The D'Amelio Show," is streaming on Hulu. -Yes.
-How is the family holding up? How's the parents? Are they going -- Yeah, is it
going to their head, the fame? -You know, the fam is good.
We are together a lot. It's great. I mean, I live with my older
sister and we work together, so we spend quite
a lot of time together. You know, sisters -- we argue,
but we love each other. -A lot of family bonding.
-Yeah. A lot. -Yeah. We love it every time
you come by. Thank you so much,
and congrats on the show and on the shoes, as well. -Thank you!
-Charli D'Amelio, everybody. Season 3 of "The D'Amelio Show"
is streaming now on Hulu. Victoria Monét
performs for us after the break. Stick around, everybody.

all_transcripts.page_content:
-Ronnie, welcome to the show.
I'm so happy to -- We hung out maybe a month ago
in London and we had
the greatest time ever. You were so funny.
You're the life of the party. -So is he. He's like this
all day long, you know. -Am I too high-energy?
-I went for dinner with him, and I had to have
a lay-down first. -Yeah. This is actually true.
We did the interview. -Yeah.
-Global interview. We were talking about
"Hackney Diamonds," which is finally out
this Friday. And we get to dinner,
and you're not there, and we go,
"Where's Ronnie and Sally?" And your wife sent a picture. She goes,
"Yeah, Ronnie's taking a nap." And there's you taking a nap. -I had to in order to
stay up all night with him. But, yeah,
that's a Rolling Stone blanket made of T-shirts
that otherwise would get lost. I think it was a great idea. -It's kind of a brilliant idea.
These are all Rolling Stones -- I go, "Do you sleep
with your swag?" And you were like, "No.
I get all these T-shirts and all this stuff and I go,
'What to do with it?'" So you made it into a quilt. -Yeah, well, it's, like,
lamb's wool-lined T-shirts. And it's, like, so warm. -It's super comfy. I love it. Let's talk about the album.
Here we go. It's been almost 20 years
since -- -It's the first time
I seen one opened up. -Is that right?
-...shrink wrap. Wow!
-I'm honored! -Hey, everybody! Welcome to the album.
I'm really honored. -How does it -- How does it feel to have a new
Rolling Stones album? -Well, I can say
it's about time. -Yes. Of course. 20 years is just about
the right amount of time. -It feels so exciting because I'm excited about every track on it.
-Yes. -Every track has got
a different thing to say and a different direction. -I mean, we can talk
about things now. We weren't even allowed
to talk about everything. You do a great song
with Lady Gaga, "Sweet Sounds of Heaven,"
that is unbelievable. And Stevie Wonder.
-Yes. -And Elton John and --
-Yeah, but Stevie Wonder and Lady are on
"Sweet Sound of Heaven," which you may have already
heard because the only ones -- only tracks
to be released so far are "Angry"
and "Sweet Sound of Heaven." And I'm just blown away
with them. I mean, to be in the studio
with that genius Stevie Wonder. -Yes, but which one are you
looking forward to the audience hearing, like,
that aren't those two? Is it the --
-"Whole Wide World." -Yeah, that's a great --
-It's a great up-tempo... ♪ Da da da da da da da da ♪ -Yes. Yeah. I love it. Yeah.
Yeah. Okay. Good. That's good. -You're gonna love that.
-You're gonna love that one. -And for the other side
of the coin, there's a country kind of
flavored song called "Dreamy Skies" where I get to play
a little slide and mix things. It's very country.
-I should mention, also, this was made after
the passing of Charlie Watts, who is obviously your brother
and your band member, one of the greatest drummers. -Yeah, well, some things
are beyond our control, and losing Charlie
was one of those things. But before he did pass,
he said to me and to the band -- Because I was the last one
to see him in his hospital room. And he said, "Just make sure that you get Steve Jordan
to cover for me. And when I get well,
I can come, you know." But he said, "Until then, please make sure
you have Steve Jordan." And Steve is like a rocket ship
behind you. It's so fantastic. -And so you got Steve.
-You know Steve. -Yeah. Absolutely. Yeah.
We love Steve. That's wild. But you got to do two songs -- Charlie plays on two songs
on this album. -Yeah.
And Andrew Watt, our producer, a magic producer.
-Andrew Watt, by the way -- -Pulled this out of the hat.
-What a great job he did. -Yeah, well, he did. He had some wonderful
little ideas, like, "Okay, let's use the drum track
of Charlie on 'Live by the Sword,' and I'll call in Bill Wyman
to get the bass." And so in Charlie's absence,
we got the band -- the original band back together. -Original Rolling Stones. Yeah. When you came
onto the Rolling Stones, that was '75, '76? -Yeah. It was '74. My first solo
album with "Shirley." -Oh, yeah.
You do know the song! A-ha! Yeah, you're just
playing with me. Yeah. -In fact, it didn't sound
anything like it. That's the funk version. -That's the fun part.
That's what makes it fun. But, so,
you come into the Stones. They're already
the Rolling Stones. Did you -- Were you a fan
of the band? Did you -- -Yeah.
Ever since I was at college. -Yeah.
-I used to race home to see them on this show called
"Ready Steady Go!" and "Thank Your Lucky Stars." All the English TV shows we had. And I'd say,
"That's my kind of music. I'm going to be in that band!" -Really?
-Yeah. -And they called you and said,
"Do you want to join the band?" And you're like,
"Yeah, of course." -Yeah, but a series
of wonderful coincidences being in the right place
at the right time made it happen for me. You know, it was just --
-Was it Keith -- Was it Keith
who you were friends with? There's a picture
of you and Keith, by the way, This is 1979, I believe. But was it Keith who -- I mean, what else could you be
besides rock stars in this photo? I mean, come on.
This is just legendary. -And that's on board our plane,
as well. -Yes. Of course it is.
Why not? Yeah, exactly. So you get together, you play
with the Rolling Stones. You're just legendary.
What a great career. And then this album comes out
and kind of -- Can we talk about this song? -"Bite My Head Off."
-"Bite My Head Off." -That's wonderful. We just
rehearsed that yesterday. We've been doing a little bit
of rehearsing to see how these songs translate live,
and they're really cooking. -Can you tell people who is
a special guest on that song? -Paul McCartney --
his big dream -- said... [ Cheers and applause ] -A Beatle is on
the Rolling Stones album! A Beatle is on
the Rolling Stones album! What is going on?! -Yeah. Well, the song goes... ♪ Bah bah bah bah bah bah bah
bah bah bah dah dah dah dah ♪ ♪ Bite my head off ♪
Right? And Paul --
he was so blown away. He was a bit like a schoolboy,
you know? A kid in a toy shop, you know?
-Yeah. -And he loved it.
He said, "My dream!" -Really? -He said, "A Beatle gets to play
on a Rolling Stones album!" Yeah, he was really knocked out.
Yeah. -It's so good.
Wait till you hear this album. It's getting great reviews,
so congratulations on that. -Yeah.
I also want to mention, by the way, that -- I know
everyone probably knows this, but maybe if you don't,
you're an amazing painter. You really are a great artist. -Thanks. I've been painting
since I was little. -Yeah. Was your family into -- -Yeah, my two older brothers. I grew up eight years
behind Ted, ten years behind Art.
-Great name. -And all of our initials
spell ART -- Art, Ron, and Ted. Anyway, so the thing is...
-Wow. -If they --
They were musicians, too. So if they played, I would play. And if they painted,
I would paint. And it just stuck with me
all the years. -I figured I'd show
just a couple just to see... -I just copied that.
That's a tribute to Van Gogh. -Yeah. It's fantastic. [ Cheers and applause ] -And this is a tribute
to Delacroix, one of my favorite
French painters. [ Cheers and applause ] -This is -- You're so talented.
I can't -- And this one... -This is a little tribute
to "Angry." -Yeah. -It's called
"Barcelona Diamonds." -Yeah. Barcelona. Go to RonnieWood.com and
check out more of Ronnie's art. I'm just so happy
that I know you, and I'm happy that you came on. I know you don't really do
talk shows. This means so much to me. And to meet your family
all backstage. The most beautiful family.
And your daughters are gorgeous. And I just want to say
thank you so much and congrats on the record. -You were so nice to them.
You made them feel so warm. -The best. This is Ronnie Wood,
ladies and gentlemen! "Hackney Diamonds"
is out this Friday. -Thank you!
-This Friday! We'll be right back
with Sam Heughan. Stick around, everybody!

metadata.title: Ronnie Wood on The Rolling Stones' Star-Studded Album and Working with Paul McCartney | Tonight Show
metadata.description:
Ronnie Wood talks about working with Lady Gaga, Stevie Wonder, Elton John and Paul McCartney on The Rolling Stones' album Hackney Diamonds, the album featuring two songs with fallen bandmate Charlie Watts, and how he got into painting.

-I always forget
how short I am until I come to your show. -Nah! You know
how to do it perfect. -I'm going to totally...
Yeah, I'm going to sit. -First of all,
by the way, look at this vinyl. -I love it. Yeah.
This is one of the colors. We have so many
different colors. I'm obsessed with vinyl.
It's beautiful. -I have too much. But yeah, I didn't like
several different colors. -You have vinyl when I did
your show when it was in Los Angeles.
-Yes. -And you had a record player
in your dressing room. -Yes, I have them everywhere.
-Do you still have it with you? -Yes, I have them everywhere.
-You're our neighbor now. You're right across the hall.
I know, rough commute today. -Yeah. Welcome.
-Yeah. I love it. But I forgot, I was telling
you backstage. Like I forget,
like, when my show ends and I'm going home,
like, your show is beginning. And so I'm running into people
in the hallway and I'm like, "This is -- I'm not this cool,
but I feel cool." [ Chuckles ] -Because, you know, everybody.
You're like, "Yeah, what's up?" -I know, you run into people,
and I'm like, "Oh, that's awesome." -Did you have a great
first -- first week here? -I did, we -- Well, I will say
my very first day, um... [ Chuckles ] I -- Look, I was very tired,
and we were working a lot, and I had -- I had gotten
a venti matcha iced tea latte and then I was just tired. I don't know what happened,
but I got on, it was F4,
the elevator, F4. -That was classic.
-And I -- Yeah. It is a -- It is a --
It is one of the most iconic elevators
ever isn't it? -Fallon 4.
-That's so funny. -Yeah.
-Um... And then I proceeded
to not only drop my drink in the entire -- Like,
I mean a full venti. And then it looked like art.
It looked like it went. It went, like, all over.
-Oh, my gosh. -And then I knew
there were cameras. So I was like, I was like,
"Oh, my God, this is going to be seen
my first time here." Anyway, I have completely
trashed an elevator. That was my first -- you -- you now have a rock star
in the building, so. -Oh, yeah.
Yeah. You trashed. -By the way... -Trashed the elevator
on my way in. -You really did. Look at this.
Oh, my gosh. -Yeah, no. And you...
-You really did. -You're not even...
-I've never seen that. -You're not even getting
the full spectrum. It went to the ceiling.
-Did you throw it? Did you slam it down?
-No! I was standing there and it
just slipped out of my hands. And I was like,
"What the...?" And it went --
It went everywhere. -Oh, my gosh.
-Yeah, yeah, yeah. -That's a great way to..
-You're welcome "30 Rock." Thank you for having me.
-[ Chuckles ] -I'm sure I'll be -- I'll be asking you
for favors like "Kelly. Please come over whenever."
-Oh, my gosh. You know I love games.
-Come sing a song. -Yeah I will sing.
I will do anything. -Yeah.
-Tap dance. Whatever. -Is there a song,
by the way, that you've sang more than any other song
besides your own songs? -Um, probably Aretha maybe. I don't know. I've sang a lot --
A lot of songs. But probably
"Never Loved a Man" by Aretha Franklin.
-Oh, really? Was that the song you would
sing, like, when you were a kid like trying out
and going to talent shows? -Oh, no. Like my very first --
I did do stuff from Aretha, but my very first song, I ever,
which was a bold song to pick. I would love to say
I was brave and bold. I was just stupid.
But I picked "Vision of Love." [ Chuckles ]
-Oh, my gosh. -Yeah.
-Mariah Carey. -I was feeling very good
about it and it went well. It went fine.
But like, I just -- Why would you pick that song
as your first song to sing in front of people?
I don't know. -Because you like,
maybe you like the pressure. -I just love the song. -Did you ever tell Mariah
that that was your song? -No. Oh, my God. So what -- [ Chuckles ]
I did, I did talk to her because I was like, "Oh, I" --
She knows I adore her. Because I've run into her
several times and she's probably got me
on some security list to, like,
keep me away, but... -Are you in The Lamb--
Are you a lamb? Are you in The Lambily?
-I'm a lamb. I love her.
I love her, yes. But I --
[ Inhales sharply ] I did something stupid.
She came on "The Voice." And we were working together,
and I just -- Sometimes I say everything
that's in my brain, and I shouldn't do that. But I was trying to say
because she was like, "Oh, yeah,
like you're writing, too." I was like, "Oh, my God,
I know all your songs." Like, I'm a huge fan of her. People don't realize
she wrote all of that. Like not just sang it,
like, she wrote everything. And she was like, "Well,
we should write together." And then in my head,
I was just like, "Oh, yeah,
I don't really write like. I can't be, like, that
vulnerable, like, in a room. I usually just like,
write on my own." And then I walked away and my,
my friends were like, "Do you, do you realize
you just told Mariah Carey no?" [ Laughter ] -Mariah Carey wants to write
a song with you, and you were like,
"That's not what it meant." -That's not what I meant.
I meant I'm not the best. Writing for me does not
come out in that scenario. I'm usually alone. Anytime you see my name
on a song, I wrote it. Usually alone. Yeah,but you would love to write
a song with Mariah Carey? -I would love to write. I love you, Mariah Carey,
and I will -- I will risk it for you.
-Yeah. Yeah. But I just also
saw you recently. You made some headlines
because you rewrote the lyrics to...
-Oh, "Piece by Piece." -"Piece by Piece."
Yeah. I didn't realize. it was going to --
Yeah, I just -- Look, I was finding a hard time
singing it, like I was like, I don't know if I want
to really sing that, you know? And I'm at a different place. And I was
a very different place, and I. -Is it hard for you for have
that happen in your personal life
when you have the talk show? -Yeah. -You're the most open and
talking every day and you're like,
"Well, now I really actually have to talk about this
because, -Yeah, I know.
-...my private life. -No, totally. And I'm going
to be real with you. Like, I -- Those were
the last two seasons specifically were very hard
like behind the scenes. I don't know
if you've ever done this. I'm sure you have, because
you've done this for so long. But, you know, sometimes you
send your representative because it's like,
I can't show up today. Like I just have to, like,
go through the motions and be a robot because I, if
I didn't, I would break down. So this is -- I'm excited about
season five here in New York because it's so -- it's --
I'm in such a great place. My little kids are
in such a great place. I'm happy, I'm present
in interviews I'm on. -Yes. [ Cheers and applause ] It's like, yeah.
Because I wasn't. -I love you, buddy. I'm here for you
if you need anything. -Thank you.
-But I was thinking about you. By the way,
congrats on the great reviews and success on "Chemistry."
-Thank you. I saw that you redid
those lyrics and I go, Oh, my gosh,
that must have been..." -But now everybody
wants me to record that one. [ Laughing ] So, I'm, like...
-That version. -The new version
of "Piece by Piece." It's like the most requested.
-When I read it, somebody wants to do,
it's called the healing version. -Yeah, it's like a --
But you know what? It is very true. Because, you know, now that
I rewrote it literally an hour before I went on stage
in Vegas to like, sing it because I was like,
I can't sing these lyrics, but I know people want me
to sing the song. And so I changed it
right before the show, and, you know, it kind of
put perspective on me as well. It's like that was a lot
of pressure to put on someone, you know, to pick up the pieces
of something of your past. So it's kind of --
It was a lot of -- There was a lot going on
for me that day, but it ended up working out. -Do you get emotional
when you...? -Do I get emotional
anywhere all the time? [ Laughter ] Like, right now?
-Hello, this is my venti. Hello!
-Welcome to 30 rock! -I did not want a venti.
I wanted a large. This is too much!
Now no one drinks it. -I just, I don't know
what happened. It slipped. It slipped.
I don't know what happened. -Wow.
-It was art. -I mean,
you're doing this. I go like, ooph.
I think I would get, like, all kind of like, I don't know if I'd make it
through the song. -I don't know, you just do. -You just do.
-Yeah, you just do. But yeah,
the audience was really -- My audience is cool. And they were like, cheering me
on because they noticed, obviously, I started
changing them. They're very intimate shows. And so these are like fans
that have been with me for the ride and they notice and then they're all like
screaming, like I'm like, "Rudy," you know, at the end
of the movie, like making it. You made it!
-Carrying on their shoulders, like, "Yeah, Kelly!" -She's making it.
-She did it. -It's -- "Chemistry"
is the name of the album. I love the title. Did you always know
that was going to be your title? -You know,
at once I wrote that song. I kind of envisioned
it as the title for it, just because it's definitely
a roller coaster. It's not just a divorce album,
it's a relationship album. There's the good
and the the bad and the hard. All of it is in there. So chemistry
can be good and bad. -Yeah. -As I've personally
found out as well. So yeah,
I kind of knew that. -I love you have a couple
of guest stars on this album. -Can you believe it?
Sheila E. is playing on -- That's right.
-Sheila E. is my... -I love her. -She's been here
and she can play. -And she's also
such a quality human. Like she's so nice.
I love her so much. And then I asked Steve Martin
because I knew he played banjo and I referenced the movie
"It's Complicated," which is one
of my favorite movies, and I've seen it
a billion times, and I love him so much. And I asked
if he would play on it, and I totally thought he was
going to say no, and he didn't. Yeah. So he's on my record.
-Wait a minute. That's your -- -That's your --
That's your guest stars Sheila E. and Steve Martin. -Who am I? -Yeah I was like,
"I have made it." -Yeah I'm happy that the new
season "Kelly Clarkson Show" is back, It's on Monday. And I thank you
for being here. And you're going to perform
for us tonight I think it's actually... But before you're doing
a special performance tomorrow night. -Yes, I am, I'm actually.
This is awesome. I'm performing -- performing --
Audacy's put together this We Can Survive concert. And a bunch of artists
are coming together for such a great cause,
and actually, I have a ticket for everybody
in the audience to come. [ Cheers and applause ] -I mean it's "One Republic,"
"Maroon 5." You guys all get tickets.
-Yeah, yeah, yeah. Giant concert,
Audacy, We Can Survive concert. -Yes!
-Kelly Clarkson, everybody. When we come back,
Kelly and I are playing
a fun new game. Stick around.
Come on back.

metadata.title: Kelly Clarkson on Her Personal Life Influencing Her Music and Turning Down Mariah Carey (Extended)
